result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary J Lammert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary J Lammert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary J Lammert was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom, for 4/20/15, plea/sentencing hearing

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; AAG Jenswold & ADA Thompson & Det. Benisch present for the State, defn present w/Atty Ruth; Ct reviews plea questionnaire and questions counsel;AAG Jenswold filed an Amended Information and offers proposed agreement for plea/sentencing; Ct expresses concerns about the recommendations; Atty Ruth offers argument for no contest plea; Ct quotes complaint; rebuttal by Atty Ruth; victim's family spoke to the court; Atty Ruth offers further argument; argument by AAG Jenswold for plea agreement; Ct speaks to the issue of "no contest" and will not accept anything less than a guilty plea to ct 2;Ct gives out JS/JT dates to counsel; Atty Ruth requests time to discuss plea with defendant; short break; Ct resumed; Atty Ruth requests more time; State affirms request; Ct gives out another plea/sent hrg; Ct adjourned.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; regarding media request for cameras in the courtroom; State has no objection; Atty Ruth objects and offers argument; Ct questions counsel; counsel responds; Ct expresses concerns, Ct ruled granting the media request; Ct adjourned.
